main event: A civilian witness reported seeing a round object with a diameter of 30-50 feet hovering over the horizon near Georgetown, Alabama on January 7, 1966.
interesting points: The object had a ring or hoop extending out 19 inches around the center horizontal and glowed like a turbine engine.
The object came to a height of 8-12 inches and emitted a blinking green light at the bottom, with a noticeable odor of sulfur (or rotten eggs).
The witness's new watch stopped at 19:27 CST when the object was observed 15-20 feet away and 20 feet off the ground.
The object disappeared in a gradual climb to the northeast after the sound of the engine increased and it accelerated very rapidly.
No evidence of heat, wind blast, or unusual radar sightings were found at the site, and the witness was considered reliable by a character reference.
sighted object: a round object with a diameter of 30-50 feet and a ring or hoop extending around the center
location: 3 miles SW of Georgetown, Alabama on Hwy 63
witnesses: a civilian, age 18, who was a student
